newsitem.title: USA: Family of Malcolm X's widow to create rehab fund.
newsitem.headline: Family of Malcolm X's widow to create rehab fund.

text.p: The family of Malcolm X's widow is creating a fund to help pay for her recovery from severe burns, a spokesman for the effort said Tuesday.

Betty Shabazz, 63, is in extremely critical condition in New York's Jacobi Medical Centre from burns suffered in a June 1 fire. The blaze, allegedly set by her troubled grandson, left her with third-degree burns over 80 percent of her body.
The Dr. Betty Shabazz Medical and Rehabilitation Fund will "help defray the costs that will occur with rehabilitation," the spokesman said. The costs could include nursing-home care and therapy.
He did not have an estimate of what the costs could be.

Shabazz, the widow of civil rights leader Malcolm X, underwent five operations to replace burned skin with a type of artificial skin. The material will help the inner layer of skin heal enough to accept a permanent graft later.
Donations to the fund will be handled by Carver Federal Savings Bank in New York.
